intro: Goniothalamus kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Kinabalu mountain wax tree, is a tropical climbing plant native to the montane forests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with a unique structure that attracts pollinators. Its fruit is a fleshy berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
